TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
I have a couple of entries, originally used for contests on r/KerbalSpaceProgram.

"Flying Vee" <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, docks with an unoccupied cruiser in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> and lands on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway

[Flying Vee album](https://imgur.com/a/Dh7iK)

Unnamed prank UFO, <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr> capable, gets to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> and lands on <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway

[UFO album](https://imgur.com/a/wgbze)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-20T08:52:46Z" title="07/20/2018 08:52  AM" data-short="5 yr">July 20, 2018</time> by Xd the great**
What the heck... I'll try it! (I need badges ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif ":sticktongue:"))
Ok, would going to the Mun count as a different <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr>?

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, HeroBrian\_333 said:
> 
> 
> Ok, would going to the Mun count as a different <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr>?
> 

Yes absolutely, tip - if you ctrl-F the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> roll of honour post you will find five exemplary Kosmokerbal Commendations, four of which specify the Mün as one of the SOIs visited. Only missions outside Kerbin's <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr> get Exploratory or Expeditionary kudos though, so since the Mün and Minmus are not outside the Kerbin <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr> the missions to these SOIs receive the appropriate highly regarded kudos awards but to receive the exceptional kudos signified by the ex- prefixes the mission has to be further afield like Duna / Ike for example or Eve / Gilly. See the prefixes notice just below rule 9 on the front page. Its pretty straightforward.

[@sturmhauke](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/190611-sturmhauke/) FYI the links you posted don't link to a K-Prize mission.

[@Xd the great](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/188222-xd-the-great/) likewise, I found a couple of X33 ships but no mission, to explain, the K-Prize award is intended reflect a report of a mission you actually flew.

Congratulations to...

[@SpaceAdmiral](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189644-spaceadmiral/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Prototype 2.

[@Scarecrow](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/65767-scarecrow/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with X-Wing (video).

... on completing the K-Prize mission and returning to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway both, demonstrating piloting precision to earn the coveted Advanced Pilot Precision Award. Thankyou for your mission reports and welcome to the K-Prize roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list, see you at the Dog and Booster. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")
[@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) flies like a rocket, lands like a plane.

no mission, no kudos ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") also pls consider rule #2

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, sturmhauke said:
> 
> 
> Sorry, fixed the links.
> 

Thanks and congratulations on earning an Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with the Flying Vee. Thanks for your mission report and welcome to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list.

FYI re: the UFO mission, was very interesting, looked like fun, an effective <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr> which clearly made orbit and landing OK eventually but unfortunately the mission appears to show a vertical takeoff which breaks rule #2 so is a technical gatecrasher. Since you have a successful mission you are immune from the ignominy of gatecrasher infamy. Rule #2 is intended to exclude rocket SSTOs and while not perfect it defines the challenge. So to explain the workaround set in precedents like [Cupcake's creative video adventures](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=1664172), a mission with UFO could count as a K-Prize if the mission report showed horizontal velocity >0.0 m/s prior to lift off i.e. a rolling <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr>, even if that is, technically, an oxymoron! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Woo, thanks! The UFO is capable of a rolling STOL takeoff too, but I understand if it doesn't qualify as-is.

It's been a while since I made a submission. But here is the suggestively named "The Bump and Grind."

It's the stock NCS adapter capped with a stock Small nose cone. Extra shiny thanks to Textures Unlimited!

Spoiler

![gSbLxEe.png](https://imgur.com/gSbLxEe.png)

Thanks for the award, [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/), it'll really help get my <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> program off the ground!

My first and last submission to the K-Prize was way back in 0.90, so I thought I'd give it a retry !

Aircraft: Pegasus VI, a medium-sized, nuclear-powered <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

![jUTcr43.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/jUTcr43.jpg)

Payload: four (4) kerbonauts to crew space station RS-300, plus one (1) 'Delta 1' autonomous relay satellite.

As you can see inside the cargo bay, two mod parts were used: the Shuttle Airlock and Sunshade from [Cormorant Aeronology](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/119951-144-cormorant-aeronology-mk3-space-shuttle/), they are merely just utility parts and do not alter the behavior of the craft in any way. The rest is fully stock.

> 
> [Imgur Album](https://imgur.com/a/IdlHbNA)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-08-19T16:35:10Z" title="08/19/2018 04:35  PM" data-short="5 yr">August 19, 2018</time> by ValCab33**
I like the wing layout...
May one reach orbit with an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> and visit another planet with a payload?

> 
> 
> On 8/23/2018 at 8:47 PM, Hummingbird Aerospace said:
> 
> 
> May one reach orbit with an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> and visit another planet with a payload?
> 

Of course, if you look at the first post rules you will see there is kudos specifically for delivering payloads to distant orbits or planet surfaces. If you mean picking up a payload there are kudos examples worked out for ore transport so we will have to see if a mission is comparable. If you could be more specific and I could give you a more specific answer.

Congratulations are in order to [@ValCab33](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129449-valcab33/) for a highly professional mission of mercy, utility & precision with Pegasus VI. Thankyou for your mission report and welcome to the K-Prize roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list, well flown ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2018-09-03T10:53:02Z" title="09/03/2018 10:53  AM" data-short="5 yr">September 3, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

Long time lurker here.

I've recently started playing KSP again (on PS4) as my desktop is kahput.

I'd really like to give this a go but I am unsure as to how and what I need to upload the where?

I cant see anything on the thread, although I may just be blind!
You need to upload screenshots or a video, showing your <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> in action. PS4s can upload to various hosts, which you can then link here.

[@Aquaticfantastic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189287-aquaticfantastic/) If you read the first post of the thread it gives you a few pointers.

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> The K Prize challenge is to make the obvious craft, a spaceplane, and make it work. All those who succeed will be included on the roll of honour and get a free back stage pass to hang with Kay Kool and the Kerbettes after their next live performance at the Dog and Booster (where free beer will be available). To enter report relevant accomplishments on a mission which actually flew, your word is good enough but images and videos are welcome.
> 

Which means you make a mission report in this thread, looking at the other mission reports should give you an idea, which can be text or image or video. To publish videos or images here you need to host them elsewhere and add a link by the appropriate means. I dont know how you do that with a PS4 as I dont have one. Imgur has its own button on the toolbar. I think a YouTube link is recognised automatically. Anyway its your call and I hope you can find a way but if you need to make a text only report that is good enough as above. We are on the honour system. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
>

To publish videos or images here you need to host them elsewhere and add a link by the appropriate means. I dont know how you do that with a PS4 as I dont have one. Imgur has its own button on the toolbar. I think a YouTube link is recognised automatically. [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) thanks for the reply! I'm rolling on imgur so will provide my report once done (picked up rdrd2 over the weekend so KSP is on the backburner at the moment). I'm not great with planes if im honest, but a challenge like this should help me improve!
Red Dead Redemption 2, another fine game from the Take Two stables, well reputed 'round these parts... yip.

I've a little Mk1 <abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer">lfo</abbr> only <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> wich i really like. Nothing fancy but my favorite so far, it has the creative name LfoOnly3. 

![GsU3HOg.jpg](http://imgur.com/GsU3HOg.jpg)

It can carry 3 kerbals and has a little siencekit in the servicebay. 

[I took it to Ike for this challenge](https://youtu.be/-CU2wPAK37g)

Dont know if that matters but i was a little to fast on final touchdown and havent set the brakesetting right so i came from the runway and pulled up again for another try.

Thanks for your video report of an awesome far reaching flight to Ike there [@PrvDancer85](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180954-prvdancer85/) going around is perfectly acceptable, its where the mission ends which counts and the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway is ... simply the best ... !

So congratulations on earning the kudos of an Exploratory Astrokerbal Distinction (Ike) and an Advanced Pilot Precision Award with LfoOnly3. Welcome to the K-Prize party guest list, aka the role of honour, fancy dress optional. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
